page.title: 14 THE CHURCH FLAGONS
page.content: There has lately been a dispute between the town council and the parish council over the ownership of 4 silver flagons which were bought in 1643 with 120 pounds left by Stephen Hayward,a Gentleman of Faversham,in his will. The Church wishes to sell the flagons and use the money to restore the church buildings.The town council says that the flagons do not belong to the Church.An entry in the Town Council Minute Book of October 23rd 1643 reads that the flagons should be for "ye use of the towne at the communion table" .The matter was taken to a rare ecclesiastical court where Judge John Newey Q.C., presiding, decided that the flagons do belong to the Parish Church but they cannot sell them for at least a year when they must prove that the money cannot be raised in any other way.
